subject: Critical Thinking
title: Expertise Verification: Is This Person Actually an Expert?
description: One-minute skill: Expertise Verification: Is This Person Actually an Expert?.

hook.text: A 'doctor' on YouTube promotes a miracle cure. He has a PhD â€“ in philosophy. His medical expertise: zero.

buildup.text: True expertise requires: relevant credentials, active research in the specific field, peer recognition, & a track.

discovery.text: Beware: expertise in one field doesn't transfer.

twist.text: The 'expert industry': media rewards confident voices, not accurate ones. Being telegenic matters more than being right.

climax.text: Check: Is the person an expert in THIS specific topic? Do other experts agree? What do they have to gain?

punchline.text: A title doesn't make an expert. Relevant expertise does.

quiz.question: What is the most important factor in verifying expertise?
options: Whether their credentials are relevant to the specific claim being made
